content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Somerset

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Somerset
fields.bodyText: Big year for Justin Langer One of the finest batsmen on the circuit, the captain will be a massive influence again In a nutshell Langer galvanised the team as captain taking their title-challenge into the final round of matches in 2009. Losing Ian Blackwell will hinder their chances this time, and the club have been quiet in the transfer market, with injury-prone paceman David Stiff their sole signing Ashes factor Limited to a few pithy press quotes from Langer and the seemingly inevitable news that Andy Caddick, now aged 40, has not yet given up hopes of an England recall Foreign flavour Zander de Bruyn, Charl Willoughby and Alfonso Thomas hail from South Africa, as does wicketkeeper Craig Kieswetter, though he did go to school nearby Well I never Borrowing the custom from Langer's time in the Australian Test team, Somerset now celebrate each win with a team song, in their case Blackbird, I'll Have 'Ee' by The Wurzels Andy Bull Bob Willis's verdict While Brian Rose's squad is certainly a developing force they will have the same problem as always – getting results at home. Getting 20 wickets at Taunton is not easy and Somerset's downfall could be too many draws Captain Justin Langer Coach Andy Hurry 2008: Championship 4th (Div 1) Pro 40 6th (Div 1) Friends Provident quarter-finals Twenty20 Cup 4th in Midlands/West/Wales group In David Stiff Out Ian Blackwell (Durham), Keith Parsons (ret), Andy Sutton (released). Overseas Justin Langer
